title: Fingerprint verification as a Service in KC Class

author: Jernej Bule, Faculty of Computer and Information Science, University of Ljubljana

segmentation: My name is Aaron Avola.
I come from computer vision lab of Faculty of Computer Information Science, University of Ljubljana.
An I will talk about fingerprint verification as a service in KOTC class.

My presentation is some sort of next step or implementation of the idea that was previously presented today from Vita Merge Truths who is also developing some sort of verification biometric verification in a cloud.
When we talk about Internet authentication for the vast majority will still talking about passwords.

The biggest problem with current authentication approaches is too many password account pairings for each user to remember, which leads to forgetting or using the same username and password for multiple sites.
Some people, including me, see a solution in the use of biometrics.
Biometric methods are quite widely used for local authentication.
That means in local environments, while the authentication on the Internet, using biometrics is still relatively unused.
Cloud computing represents a solution with its almost unlimited storage capacity and capability of Rd rapid data distribution and parallel processing.
The aim of our work in project cuts.
A class is the implementation of biometric verification system based on fingerprints in cloud platform.
Within this work we develop our own system for verification of persons based on fingerprints.
We integrate that system into a cloud platform.
We address as we address aspects of data security, an authentication data Fusion, and in the end we use a learning system model as a test environment for proof of concept.
Through Percipi trooper see Dictation in Kochi class with a low over own model for verification of persons based on fingerprints.
Code, finger, finger, event finger intent can be divided into 2 main parts that are user registration and verification process.
AB Ametric recognition system.
As you know, can operate in two modes that are verification.
An identification verification is termed as.
Were verification accepts or rejects the claim over person, while identification determines which of the register persons are given.
Biometric data corresponds to.
We use verification in our system, which means that the user must for enter a PIN number or some sort of user name that was previously chosen when registering.
Verification is also termed as one to one matching, which of course increased the level of security and reliability.
Our integration of fingerprint.
Engine is provided on this figure.
Verification process is done using the following scenario.
First the image is taken from fingerprint scanner.
In number or some sort of user name is provided.
To the application application can be desktop or web application.
Application then communicates with AP API which is stored in cloud.
Which runs in a cloud.
Encoded image and other data are sent to the.
Processing service API in the cloud and the results are then sent back to the to the user or our application.
As you see we store.
Templates.
In the cloud.
Solution is modularly designed.
This upgrading is possible over API.
Solution could be used for other biometric modalities.
Also in the context of multimodal biometric authentication.
Without a Fusion, when we talk about data Fusion, we think about that we want to integrate data from different authentication processes into useful representation.
We combine authentication.
Data from desktop and other web applications applications such as model into one useful representation.
Security of our solution is provided on different levels.
Some of them are.
Let's say the important ones are the use of HTTPS protocol for data transfer.
Acrim encryption of passwords and odd other data stored in the database.
Our services in the cloud are protected with complex passwords, so access to them is without password is impossible.
In this view, we see a proof of concept of our solution model learning system.
Our API solution.
Hosted in a cloud.
The main purpose of this integration is to provide additional level of security.
User must first enter username, password and fingerprint.
Which means additional level of security as I said.
The main problem we face here is comparability of various fingerprint with readers with Internet browsers.
Man, each manufacturer has its own standards, its own protocols.
They are not always available and also the standard is not available in this area.
Yet.
To conclude, our primary goal of this project work in this project is working fingerprint based biometric verification in a cloud platform.
Our proposed solution can be easily applied to different biometric modalities, such as face recognition, voice recognition, or some other.
A pilot version of the entire system is already installed, but there are many challenges and obstacles that we need to address in the future.
At the end I would like to.
Invite all interested users or partners that would like to use.
Our system in your environment to contact us.
For further information, thank you.
Let's thank you Nebula for this presentation.
Does anyone have any question for Ernie?
I wonder which underlying cloud solution did you use since the model showed that yes, we can partly used Amazon, Amazon Azure, Cloud, Windows Azure, yes.
Which is which technologies from Asus?
'cause actually serve Asure Azure is a set of technologies like SQL Azure app Fabric, Asure for compute and storage.
There are also some service buses components that are involved, so we use that exact standard solution with SQL SQL database which is hosted at them in their cloud.
And that's most likely SQL Azure.
Yes, yes.
Thanks for representation.
